alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 8:57PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect southern Oxford... southwestern Androscoggin...northwestern Cumberland...southeastern Coos...eastern Grafton and northeastern Carroll Counties... At 856 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was 11 miles northeast of Pinkham Notch, or 13 miles southwest of Bethel...moving south AT 25 MPH. Locations impacted include... Berlin, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Bethlehem, Naples, Waterford, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, Raymond, Carroll, Durham, Casco, Gorham, Harrison, Hebron, Lovell, Jefferson, Greenwood and Jackson. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 69 and 78. This also includes... Mount Jefferson, Mount Madison, Mount Eisenhower, Wildcat Mountain, and Speckled Mountain. * Brief gusty winds are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Snowfall accumulation up to a quick inch is possible in this area of heavy snow showers. Travel is not advised during these heavy snow showers. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the snow showers pass your location. If traveling pull off to a safe location.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Southern Oxford
